scenes.background: You are leading a project team that has just received an urgent assignment requiring a significant amount of work to be completed within a tight deadline. The team is feeling a lot of pressure, and morale is low, with some members showing signs of frustration and anxiety. Previously, when one of the team members, Alex, said, 'This is impossible! We can't get this done in time,' you responded by encouraging the team to stay focused and work together. Following that, during a team meeting, [Monica] slammed her pen on the table and added, 'Even if we try our best, there's no way we can meet this deadline.' [Bob] nodded in agreement, looking equally concerned. You acknowledged Monica's feelings and suggested a pragmatic approach to prioritize work, but the tension remained high. [Bob] then leaned back in his chair, crossing his arms, and said, 'Prioritizing won't change the fact that we’re understaffed and overworked. What’s the point?' You tried to motivate the team by recalling past successes.
scenes.description: [Monica] sighs deeply and says, 'I just don't see how working smart will get us through this. What if we miss the deadline? What then?' [Bob] looks at you expectantly, waiting for your response.

options.text: Monica, we need to stay positive and focus on what we can control. Let's make the best of the situation.
options.analysis: You tried to keep the team positive and focused, showing good motivational skills and empathy.

options.text: I understand your concerns, Monica. If we miss the deadline, we will deal with the consequences then. Right now, let's concentrate on giving our best effort.
options.analysis: You acknowledged the potential for failure but emphasized the importance of effort, demonstrating good emotional perception and self-regulation.

options.text: If we miss the deadline, we'll have to face the music, but right now, stressing about it won't help. Let's just focus on what we can do.
options.analysis: You downplayed the consequences of missing the deadline, focusing on immediate actions, showing good self-regulation but lower empathy.
